description: The role segment contains the data necessary to add, update, correct, and delete from the record persons involved, as well as their functional involvement with the activity being transmitted.

fields.name: Role Instance ID
fields.description: This field contains a unique identifier of the specific role record.

fields.name: Entity Identifier
fields.description: The first component, <entity identifier>, is usually defined to be unique within the series of identifiers created by the <assigning authority>, defined by a hierarchic designator, represented by components 2 through 4. (See Section 2.8.20, HD - hierarchic designator.)

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: See Section 2.8.20.1, Namespace ID (IS) for definition.

fields.name: Universal Id
fields.description: See Section 2.8.20.2, Universal ID (ST) for definition..

fields.name: Universal Id Type
fields.description: Refer to HL7 table 0301 - Universal ID type for valid values. See Section 2.8.20.2 Universal ID (ST), for definition.

fields.name: Action Code
fields.description: This field reveals the intent of the message. Refer to HL7 table 0287 - Problem/goal action code for valid values.

fields.name: Role-ROL
fields.description: This field indicates the functional involvement with the activity being transmitted (e.g., Case Manager, Evaluator, Transcriber, etc.).

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the <text>. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: Name or description of the item in question. E.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression. Its data type is string (ST).

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: Each coding system is assigned a unique identifier. This component will serve to identify the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item. Each system has a unique identifier. ASTM E1238-94, Diagnostic, procedure, observation, drug ID, and health outcomes coding systems are identified in the tables in Section 7.1.4, Coding schemes. Others may be added as needed. When an HL7 table is used for a CE data type, the name of coding system component is defined as HL7nnnn where nnnn is the HL7 table number.

fields.name: Alternate Components
fields.description: These three components are defined analogously to the above for the alternate or local coding system. If the Alternate Text component is absent, and the Alternate Identifier is present, the Alternate Text will be taken to be the same as the Text component. If the Alternate Coding System component is absent, it will be taken to mean the locally-defined system.

fields.name: Role Person
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite ID Number And Name For Persons
fields.description: This field contains the identity of the person who is assuming the role that is being transmitted.

fields.name: Id Number
fields.description: This string refers to the coded ID according to a user-defined table, defined by the 9th component. If the first component is present, either the source table or the assigning authority must be valued.

fields.name: Suffix
fields.description: Used to specify a name suffix (e.g., Jr. or III).

fields.name: Prefix
fields.description: Used to specify a name prefix (e.g., Dr.).

fields.name: Degree
fields.description: Used to specify an educational degree (e.g., MD). Refer to user-defined table 0360 Degree for suggested values.

fields.name: Source Table
fields.description: User-defined table 0297 - CN ID source is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component. Used to delineate the first component.

fields.name: Assigning Authority
fields.description: The assigning authority is a unique identifier of the system (or organization or agency or department) that creates the data. It is a HD data type. Assigning authorities are unique across a given HL7 implementation. User-defined table 0363 Assigning authority is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for the first sub-component of the HD component, <namespace ID>.

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: User-defined table 0300 - Namespace ID is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

fields.name: Universal Id
fields.description: The HDs second component, <universal ID (UID), is a string formatted according to the scheme defined by the third component, <universal ID type> (UID type). The UID is intended to be unique over time within the UID type. It is rigorously defined. Each UID must belong to one of the specifically enumerated schemes for constructing UIDs (defined by the UID type). The UID (second component) must follow the syntactic rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component). Note that these syntactic rules are not defined within HL7 but are defined by the rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component).

fields.name: Universal Id Type
fields.description: The third component governs the interpretation of the second component of the HD. If the third component is a known UID refer to HL7 table 0301 - Universal ID type for valid values, then the second component is a universal ID of that type.

fields.name: Name Type Code
fields.description: A code that represents the type of name. Refer to HL7 table 0200 - Name type for valid values (see Section 2.8.51, XPN - extended person name).

fields.name: Identifier Check Digit
fields.description: The check digit in this data type is not an add-on produced by the message processor. It is the check digit that is part of the identifying number used in the sending application. If the sending application does not include a self-generated check digit in the identifying number, this component should be valued null.

fields.name: Code Identifying The Check Digit Scheme Employed
fields.description: Refer to HL7 table 0061 - Check digit scheme for valid values.

fields.name: Identifier Type Code
fields.description: A code corresponding to the type of identifier. In some cases, this code may be used as a qualifier to the <assigning authority> component. Refer to user-defined table 0203 - Identifier type for suggested values.

fields.name: Assigning Facility
fields.description: The place or location identifier where the identifier was first assigned to the person. This component is not an inherent part of the identifier but rather part of the history of the identifier: as part of this data type, its existence is a convenience for certain intercommunicating systems.

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: User-defined table 0300 - Namespace ID is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

Each UID must belong to one of the specifically enumerated schemes for constructing UIDs (defined by the UID type). The UID (second component) must follow the syntactic rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component). Note that these syntactic rules are not defined within HL7 but are defined by the rules of the particular universal identifier scheme (defined by the third component).

fields.name: Name Representation Code
fields.description: Different <name/address types> and representations of the same <name/address> should be described by repeating of this field, with different values of the <name/address type> and/or <name/address representation> component.

fields.name: Role Begin Date/Time
fields.description: This field contains the date/time when the role began.

fields.name: Role End Date/Time
fields.description: This field contains the date/time when the role ended.

fields.name: Role Duration
fields.description: This field contains the qualitative length of time for performance of a role (e.g., until the next assessment, four days, until discharge, etc.).
